member.name: T:System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback
member.summary: Receives the error code, number of bytes, and overlapped value type when an I/O operation completes on the thread pool.
member.param: The error code.
The number of bytes that are transferred.
A representing an unmanaged pointer to the native overlapped value type.

member.name: T:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped
member.summary: Provides an explicit layout that is visible from unmanaged code and that will have the same layout as the Win32 OVERLAPPED structure with additional reserved fields at the end.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.EventHandle
member.summary: Specifies the handle to an event set to the signaled state when the operation is complete. The calling process must set this member either to zero or to a valid event handle before calling any overlapped functions.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.InternalHigh
member.summary: Specifies the length of the data transferred. Reserved for operating system use.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.InternalLow
member.summary: Specifies a system-dependent status. Reserved for operating system use.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.OffsetHigh
member.summary: Specifies the high word of the byte offset at which to start the transfer.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.OffsetLow
member.summary: Specifies a file position at which to start the transfer.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Overlapped
member.summary: Provides a managed representation of a Win32 OVERLAPPED structure, including methods to transfer information from an instance to a structure.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new, empty instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified file position, the 32-bit integer handle to an event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete, and an interface through which to return the results of the operation.
member.param: The low word of the file position at which to start the transfer.
The high word of the file position at which to start the transfer.
The handle to an event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete.
An object that implements the interface and provides status information on the I/O operation.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified file position, the handle to an event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete, and an interface through which to return the results of the operation.
member.param: The low word of the file position at which to start the transfer.
The high word of the file position at which to start the transfer.
The handle to an event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete.
An object that implements the interface and provides status information on the I/O operation.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.AsyncResult
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that provides status information on the I/O operation.
member.returns: An object that implements the interface.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.EventHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the 32-bit integer handle to a synchronization event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete.
member.returns: An value representing the handle of the synchronization event.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.EventHandleIntPtr
member.summary: Gets or sets the handle to the synchronization event that is signaled when the I/O operation is complete.
member.returns: An representing the handle of the event.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Free(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Frees the unmanaged memory associated with a native overlapped structure allocated by the method.
member.param: A pointer to the structure to be freed.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.OffsetHigh
member.summary: Gets or sets the high-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer. The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.
member.returns: An value representing the high word of the file position.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.OffsetLow
member.summary: Gets or sets the low-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer. The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.
member.returns: An value representing the low word of the file position.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Pack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure, specifying the delegate to be invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: The current has already been packed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Pack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure, specifying a delegate that is invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete and a managed object that serves as a buffer.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
An object or array of objects representing the input or output buffer for the operation. Each object represents a buffer, for example an array of bytes.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: The current has already been packed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Unpack(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Unpacks the specified unmanaged structure into a managed object.
member.param: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.returns: An object containing the information unpacked from the native structure.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.UnsafePack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure specifying the delegate to invoke when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete. Does not propagate the calling stack.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: The current has already been packed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.UnsafePack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure, specifying the delegate to invoke when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete and the managed object that serves as a buffer. Does not propagate the calling stack.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
An object or array of objects representing the input or output buffer for the operation. Each object represents a buffer, for example an array of bytes.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: T:System.Threading.PreAllocatedOverlapped
member.summary: Represents pre-allocated state for native overlapped I/O operations.

member.name: M:System.Threading.PreAllocatedOverlapped.#ctor(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies a delegate to invoke when each asynchronous I/O operation is complete, a user-provided object that provides context, and managed objects that serve as buffers.
member.param: A delegate that represents the callback method to invoke when each asynchronous I/O operation completes.
A user-supplied object that distinguishes the instance produced from this object from other instances. Its value can be .
An object or array of objects that represent the input or output buffer for the operations. Each object represents a buffer, such as an array of bytes. Its value can be .
member.exception: This method was called after the was disposed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.PreAllocatedOverlapped.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the resources associated with this instance.

member.name: M:System.Threading.PreAllocatedOverlapped.Finalize
member.summary: Frees unmanaged resources before the current instance is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle
member.summary: Represents an I/O handle that is bound to the system thread pool and enables low-level components to receive notifications for asynchronous I/O operations.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.AllocateNativeOverlapped(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns an unmanaged pointer to a structure, specifying a delegate that is invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete, a user-provided object that supplies context, and managed objects that serve as buffers.
member.param: A delegate that represents the callback method to invoke when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this instance from other instances.
An object or array of objects that represent the input or output buffer for the operation, or . Each object represents a buffer, such an array of bytes.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: This method was called after the object was disposed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.AllocateNativeOverlapped(System.Threading.PreAllocatedOverlapped)
member.summary: Returns an unmanaged pointer to a structure using the callback state and buffers associated with the specified object.
member.param: An object from which to create the pointer.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.exception: is currently in use for another I/O operation.
This method was called after the was disposed. -or- This method was called after was disposed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.BindHandle(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle)
member.summary: Returns a for the specified handle, which is bound to the system thread pool.
member.param: An object that holds the operating system handle. The handle must have been opened for overlapped I/O in unmanaged code.
member.returns: A for , which is bound to the system thread pool.
member.exception: has been disposed. -or- does not refer to a valid I/O handle. -or- refers to a handle that has not been opened for overlapped I/O. -or- refers to a handle that has already been bound.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all unmanaged resources used by the instance.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.FreeNativeOverlapped(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Frees the memory associated with a structure allocated by the method.
member.param: An unmanaged pointer to the structure to be freed.
member.exception: This method was called after the object was disposed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.GetNativeOverlappedState(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Returns the user-provided object that was specified when the instance was allocated by calling the method.
member.param: An unmanaged pointer to the structure from which to return the associated user-provided object.
member.returns: A user-provided object that distinguishes this instance from other instances, or if one was not specified when the instance was allocated by calling the method.

member.name: P:System.Threading.ThreadPoolBoundHandle.Handle
member.summary: Gets the bound operating system handle.
member.returns: An object that holds the bound operating system handle.
